net.opentsdb.core

Class SaltScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.opentsdb.core.SaltScanner

  • public class SaltScanner
extends Object
    A class that handles coordinating the various scanners created for each salt bucket when salting is enabled. Each scanner stores it's results in local maps and once everyone has reported in, then the maps are parsed and combined into a proper set of spans to return to the TsdbQuery class. Note that if one or more of the scanners throws an exception, then that exception will be returned to the caller in the deferred. Unfortunately we don't have a good way to cancel a scan in progress so the first scanner with an error will store it, then we wait for all of the other scanners to complete. Concurrency is important in this class as the scanners are executing asynchronously and can modify variables at any time.
    Since:
    2.2

    • Constructor Detail

      • SaltScanner

        public SaltScanner(TSDB tsdb,
                   byte[] metric,
                   List<org.hbase.async.Scanner> scanners,
                   TreeMap<byte[],Span> spans,
                   List<TagVFilter> filters)
        Default ctor that performs some validation. Call scan after construction to actually start fetching data.
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The TSDB to which we belong
        metric - The metric we're expecting to fetch
        scanners - A list of HBase scanners, one for each bucket
        spans - The span map to store results in
        filters - A list of filters for processing
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any required data was missing or we had invalid parameters.

      • SaltScanner

        public SaltScanner(TSDB tsdb,
                   byte[] metric,
                   List<org.hbase.async.Scanner> scanners,
                   TreeMap<byte[],Span> spans,
                   List<TagVFilter> filters,
                   boolean delete,
                   RollupQuery rollup_query,
                   QueryStats query_stats,
                   int query_index,
                   TreeMap<byte[],HistogramSpan> histogramSpans,
                   long max_bytes,
                   long max_data_points)
        Default ctor that performs some validation. Call scan after construction to actually start fetching data.
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The TSDB to which we belong
        metric - The metric we're expecting to fetch
        scanners - A list of HBase scanners, one for each bucket
        spans - The span map to store results in
        delete - Whether or not to delete the queried data
        rollup_query - An optional rollup query config. May be null.
        filters - A list of filters for processing
        query_stats - A stats object for tracking timing
        query_index - The index of the sub query in the main query list
        histogramSpans - The histo map to populate.
        max_bytes - The maximum number of bytes pulled out from all scanners combined.
        max_data_points - The maximum number of data points pulled out from all scanners (estimated).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any required data was missing or we had invalid parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • scan

        public com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<TreeMap<byte[],Span>> scan()
        Starts all of the scanners asynchronously and returns the data fetched once all of the scanners have completed. Note that the result may be an exception if one or more of the scanners encountered an exception. The first error will be returned, others will be logged.
        Returns:
        A deferred to wait on for results.

      • scanHistogram

        public com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<TreeMap<byte[],HistogramSpan>> scanHistogram()
